Description: Ampulla; clay; flat, circular sides with designs in relief. On each side is a series of concentric patterns, separated by plain borders, mostly double. At the centre is a rosette, surrounded by two bands of studs, and an outer band of radiating curved ridges. Both sides come from moulds produced from the same archetype. The mouth is largely broken away and the surface on one side slightly damaged. Pale orange-brown fabric with a scatter of white sand inclusions.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in Alexandria. Late Roman, about AD 480-650. Bibliog: Murray 1907: pl. v:5.
Bibliographic references: Dalton 1901 / Catalogue of Early Christian Antiquities and Objects from the Christian East in the Department of British and Medieval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (899)
Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3463)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
